block.p: A series of expeditions to the "far side" of Antarctica are among trips to remote areas scheduled for next fall and winter. The trips to Antarctica are being arranged by Quark Expeditions, which is using a Russian icebreaker, the 112-passenger Kapitan Khlebnikov. The three journeys, ranging from 28 to 31 days, begin in November and end in February.

The route of the first trip is from Cape Town to Antarctica and then on to Fremantle, Australia. Passengers will visit the Sub-Antarctic islands to see emperor penguins and other wildlife in the Indian and Pacific Oceans. Fares range from $11,975 to $16,475 a person in double occupancy. Air fares, ranging from about $1,900 to $2,700, depending on which trip is taken, are extra. The route of the second voyage is Fremantle to Fremantle and the third, Fremantle to Bluff, New Zealand. Information: Quark Expeditions, 980 Post Road, Darien, Conn. 06820; (203) 656-0499 or (800) 356-5699.

Another remote area, the Kurile Islands, will be visited during a 16-day trip organized by R.E.I. Adventures scheduled to leave Anchorage on Sept. 1. After flying to Khabarovsk in the Russian Republic's Far East, participants will go to Sakhalin Island just north of the Sea of Japan to view the volcanic landscape and observe wildlife found only in the region, which lies between the Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia and Hokkaido Island in Japan.

The fare of $2,750 includes accommodations, meals and transportation by ferry, sailboat and kayak. Air fare is extra and ranges from $1,100 to $1,830 from Anchorage. Air fare to Anchorage is also extra. Information: R.E.I. Adventures, Post Office Box 1938, Sumner, Wash. 98390; (206) 891-2631 or (800) 622-2236.

The luxury adventure ship Frontier Spirit will visit the Kurile Islands, Vladivostok and other Russian Far East ports on a 19-day voyage leaving Nome, Alaska, on Sept. 9 and crossing the Bering Strait. The itinerary also includes Kanazawa and Matsue in Japan and Pusan in South Korea.

Fares for the cruise alone start at $6,000 a person in double occupancy. As part of a 22-day package, including round-trip air fare and hotel accommodations and sightseeing in Anchorage, Nome, Pusan and Seoul, fares begin at $8,200 a person, but discounts of up to $1,650 a person are available for those who make reservations by July 31. Information: Seaquest Cruises, 600 Corporate Drive, Suite 410, Fort Lauderdale, Fla. 33334; (305) 772-7552 or (800) 223-5688.
